parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Unintentional Braking due to Faulty YAW Sensor and Lateral Movement Sensor
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden and unpredictable application of brakes can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially fatal consequences.
symptoms: The brakes apply randomly at various speeds
causing the vehicle to jerk or swerve
often accompanied by a scraping noise. The BAS/ESP light may come on
and the vehicle may become undrivable.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake light mechanism can cause the brake lights to malfunction, leading to a potential rear-end crash.
symptoms: Brake lights not working
brake lights not illuminating
brake lights failing repeatedly
thermal deformation of the socket base
failure of brake lamp bulbs to illuminate.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Failure of Electrical Components (Relay, On-Board Computers, Cooling Fan Control Monitor)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of electrical components can cause various systems to malfunction, leading to safety issues, such as overheating engines, and inconvenience to the driver.
symptoms: Electric seats not working
relay failure
on-board computer failure
cooling fan control monitor failure
engine overheating
short circuit inside the electrical system.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Rear Brake Light Failure Due to Heat Deformed Bulb Socket
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear brake lights can increase the risk of accidents, as other drivers may not be aware of the vehicle's braking intentions, leading to potential rear-end collisions.
symptoms: The rear brake lights do not illuminate
the brake lights are dim or flickering
the brake light assembly is damaged or deformed.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Unintended Brake Activation by Stability Control System
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The unintended activation of the brakes by the stability control system can cause the vehicle to suddenly slow down or stop, leading to a loss of control, accidents, or near-misses, which can put the driver and other motorists at risk of injury or death.
symptoms: The brakes are applied suddenly and without warning
the vehicle yaws or skids
the ESP warning light illuminates
the BAS/ESP warning light illuminates
the vehicle rumbles or vibrates
the vehicle stops or slows down unexpectedly.
